A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Poorly written\, lazily directed\, characters completely departed from who all prior films set them up to be; many storylines unnecessary and important\, relevant ones were disregarded or dropped\, and there were so many glaring holes in the plot that all suspension of disbelief was dropped. As a long time Star Wars fan who was excited for the new trilogy\, this was immensely disappointing to me. The only time I have been more disappointed in a film I paid to see was Shymalan's Avatar: The Last Airbender. This film has singlehandedly managed to make Star Wars boring and predictable for me\, and I will not be paying to go see any future Star Wars movies unless Disney rectifies this somehow.
